headline.main: MADISON AVENUE'S CAST OF FAMOUS FACES

results.snippet: A MERICA'S not gonna be pushed around anymore,'' says Frank Sinatra.  So do Gregory Peck, Bill Cosby, Angie Dickinson, Ernest Borgnine, Johnny Cash, Sally Struthers, plus a showroom full of other stars.  They are helping to remind Americans that the...
results.lead_paragraph: A MERICA'S not gonna be pushed around anymore,'' says Frank Sinatra. So do Gregory Peck, Bill Cosby, Angie Dickinson, Ernest Borgnine, Johnny Cash, Sally Struthers, plus a showroom full of other stars. They are helping to remind Americans that the desperate Chrysler Corporation has some ''K'' cars to sell. If the stars had not all agreed to work merely for scale, $275 a day, Chrysler would have spent hundreds of thousands of dollars anyway to procure their services. The company needed star power.

results.abstract: Andrew Feinberg article on use of famous actors to sell merchandise; various celebrities give their views of their advertising roles; illustration (L)

headline.main: Madison Avenue's Cast of Famous Faces

results.snippet: "AMERICA'S not gonna be pushed around anymore," says Frank  Sinatra. So do Gregory Peck, Bill Cosby, Angie Dickinson, Ernest Borgnine, Johnny Cash, Saily Struthers, plus a showroom full of other stars. They are helping to remind Americans that the...
results.lead_paragraph: "AMERICA'S not gonna be pushed around anymore," says Frank Sinatra. So do Gregory Peck, Bill Cosby, Angie Dickinson, Ernest Borgnine, Johnny Cash, Saily Struthers, plus a showroom full of other stars. They are helping to remind Americans that the desperate Chrysler Corporation has some "K" cars to sell.

results.snippet: As an uncontrollable place dropper, I have found in Bhutan the ultimate place to drop. This Himalayan kingdom of a million people, wedged between India and Tibet, is remote, exotic and, best of all, will not let in more than 1,500 tourists a year....
results.lead_paragraph: As an uncontrollable place dropper, I have found in Bhutan the ultimate place to drop. This Himalayan kingdom of a million people, wedged between India and Tibet, is remote, exotic and, best of all, will not let in more than 1,500 tourists a year. You are unlikely to meet anyone else who has been there or who can contradict you about the place. In the past I used to get a lot of dinner-table mileage out of places like Gisenyi on the shores of Lake Kivu in Ruanda, or Alaska's Point Hope on the Chukchi Sea. While others brought up Acapulco I would counter with the Seychelles or Cox's Bazaar in Bangladesh.These places served me well, but Bhutan puts them all in the shade and now the only thing I worry about is runni ng into an astronaut or people who have been to Ulan Bator - not coun ting Mongolians, of course.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: REVIEWS AND OTHER DATA ON SPECIFIC PRODUCTIONS

results.snippet: WHEN they stopped making psychedelic films some years ago, they stopped for a reason. A spongy state of  mind is the requisite for watching something like Tony Palmer's "The Space Movie," which is a throwback to a sensibility long gone.
results.lead_paragraph: WHEN they stopped making psychedelic films some years ago, they stopped for a reason. A spongy state of mind is the requisite for watching something like Tony Palmer's "The Space Movie," which is a throwback to a sensibility long gone.

results.snippet: WHEN they stopped making psychedelic films some years ago, they stopped for a reason. A spongy state of mind is the requisite for watching something like Tony Palmer's ''The Space Movie,'' which is a throwback to a sensibility long gone. Mr. Palmer...
results.lead_paragraph: WHEN they stopped making psychedelic films some years ago, they stopped for a reason. A spongy state of mind is the requisite for watching something like Tony Palmer's ''The Space Movie,'' which is a throwback to a sensibility long gone. Mr. Palmer has compiled footage from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the National Archives, piled on a lulling musical accompaniment, and invited his audience to lay back and groove. They may yawn instead. ''The Space Movie,'' which opens today at the Guild Theater, takes no discernible attitude toward its subject; it simply watches the rockets blast off, or the astronauts drift weightlessly or the planets roll by. These things are eminently watchable, of course, but Mr. Palmer assembles the film so choppily that there's never time to relax with a single image. Just when the surface of the moon is becoming mesmerizing, you'll see an unwanted closeup of an instrument panel, or hear highly technical conversations from Cape Canaveral; the pace of the film is relentlessly nervous.

results.snippet: WHEN they stopped making psychedelic films some years ago, they stopped for a reason. A spongy state of mind is the requisite for watching something like Tony Palmer's ''The Space Movie,'' which is a throwback to a sensibility long gone. Mr. Palmer...

They may yawn instead. ''The Space Movie,'' which opens today at the Guild Theater, takes no discernible attitude toward its subject; it simply watches the rockets blast off, or the astronauts drift weightlessly or the planets roll by. These things are eminently watchable, of course, but Mr. Palmer assembles the film so choppily that there's never time to relax with a single image. headline.main: Movie: From Philippines, 'Perfumed Nightmare'; A Primitive Film

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: REVIEWS AND OTHER DATA ON SPECIFIC PRODUCTIONS

results.snippet: AS a general rule one should be skeptical when a film maker is described as a primitive. Because it's virtually impossible  to be primitive in a discipline of such technical sophistication, genuinely primitive film makers are more rare than genuinely...
results.lead_paragraph: AS a general rule one should be skeptical when a film maker is described as a primitive. Because it's virtually impossible to be primitive in a discipline of such technical sophistication, genuinely primitive film makers are more rare than genuinely primitive nuclear physicists.

results.snippet: AS a general rule one should be skeptical when a film maker is described as a primitive. Because it's virtually impossible to be primitive in a discipline of such technical sophistication, genuinelyprimitive fil m makers are more rare than genuinely...
results.lead_paragraph: AS a general rule one should be skeptical when a film maker is described as a primitive. Because it's virtually impossible to be primitive in a discipline of such technical sophistication, genuinelyprimitive fil m makers are more rare than genuinely primitive nuclear physicists. The quite extraordinary exception to this rule is a 38-year-old Philippine film maker named Kidlat Tahimik, whose first feature, ''The Perfumed Nightmare,'' opens today in the Agee Room at the Bleecker Street Cinema. Here is a sweet, funny, witty, intelligent little movie, which is also primitive to the extent that its style is direct, sometimes awkward but always unselfconscious. It tends to defy analysis by being so successfully - and so exactly - what it appears to be, that is, a meditation by a young man on his life and the world he aspires to join.

headline.main: SOVIET SPACECRAFT CARRIES CREW OF 3 TO RENDEZVOUS WITH ORBITING LAB

results.snippet: A space capsule carrying the Soviet Union's first three-man crew in nine years made a computer-guided docking with the Salyut 6 orbiting laboratory today, according to Tass, the official Soviet press agency.         Tass said all systems were...
results.lead_paragraph: A space capsule carrying the Soviet Union's first three-man crew in nine years made a computer-guided docking with the Salyut 6 orbiting laboratory today, according to Tass, the official Soviet press agency. Tass said all systems were functioning normally and the astronauts were feeling well. It is the first space mission for two of the astronauts, Leonid Kizim, the 39-year-old flight commander, and Gennady Strekalov, the 40-year-old flight engineer. Oleg Makarov, the 47-year-old co-pilot, has made two previous flights for which he received the title of pilot astronaut and two awards of Hero of the Soviet Union.

results.abstract: spacecraft makes computer-guided docking orbiting Salyut space station; all systems reported functioning normally (M)

headline.main: Soviet Spacecraft Carries Crew of 3 To Rendezvous With Orbiting Lab; 'A Fourth Crew Member'

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (UPI)--A space capsule carrying the Soviet Union's first three-man crew in nine years made a computer-guided docking with the Salyut 6 orbiting laboratory today, according to Tass, the official Soviet press agency.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (UPI)--A space capsule carrying the Soviet Union's first three-man crew in nine years made a computer-guided docking with the Salyut 6 orbiting laboratory today, according to Tass, the official Soviet press agency.
